evidence: Clear separation of concerns with dedicated modules for models, admin, cache, signals, and utilities
Two-package structure (tests and treenode) with well-defined boundaries
Low average fan-out (2.125) indicating loose coupling between modules
Directory depth of 2 suggests a flat, organized module structure
Presence of Django-specific components (models, admin, forms) organized in a cohesive package
Comprehensive test suite separated from main implementation code
Internal modules like cache, signals, and utils are decoupled and reusable
risks: Tight coupling to Django framework may limit portability
Cache and signal modules might introduce implicit dependencies
Low maintainability index (15.58 min) in some files could indicate complexity issues
